document.docAuthor: Ghahari, Hassan, Volkovitsh, Mark G. & Bellamy, Charles L.
document.masterDocTitle: An annotated catalogue of the Buprestidae of Iran (Coleoptera: Buprestoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An annotated catalogue of the Buprestidae of Iran (Coleoptera: Buprestoidea)

subSubSection.paragraph: synonym: Jalodis Eschscholtz 1829 .

synonym:
Phyllis Gistel 1834
.

synonym:
Saccosoma Motschulsky 1859
.
Note. The larvae of Julodinae are soil habitants feeding externally on the roots of different plants. All the records herein refer to adults only.

Host plant(s) within Iran .

None recorded.

Note. Most probably a synonym of
J. partha Obenberger 1923
(V. Kubáň, personal communication).

* Julodis cailliaudi
(
Latreille) 1827
: 277
(
Buprestis
);
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006
: 327

Bellamy 2008 a

( caillaudi [sic!]); Kubáň in

subSubSection.paragraph:
synonym: aethiopica Laporte 1835 : 162 ;
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006
: 327 ;
Bellamy, 2008 a
: 54 (synonym of caillaudi [sic!]); Kubáň in
Bílý et al . 2011
: 170 .

Distribution within Iran .
Bushehr (
Ghahari & Bellamy 2012
),?southern Iran (
Jakobson 1913
; Kubáň in
Bílý et al . 2011
).

Distribution outside Iran .
? Algeria , Cameroon , Central African Republic , Chad , Democratic Republic of Congo , Egypt , Eritrea , Ethiopia , Gambia ,? Libya , Mali , Mauritania , Niger , Nigeria , Senegal , Sudan ,? Tunisia (Kubáň in
Bílý et al . 2011
).

Note. The occurrence of this species in Iran needs confirmation. Previously it was indicated for Iran by
Jakobson ( 1913 )
who cited the old publication of
Osculati ( 1844 )
.

).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution within Iran .
Bushehr (
Obenberger 1928 b, as
hauseri
), Fars (
Modarres Awal 1997
, as
gotwendensis hauseri
), Iran (no locality cited) (
Kerremans 1914
;
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006
;
Bellamy 2008 a
).
Distribution outside Iran .
None recorded.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Julodis consobrina gotwendensis
Obenberger 1924 c
: 6
(subspecies of ethema );
Bílý 1983 a
: 31
;
Borumand 2002
: 2
;
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006
: 327

Bellamy 2008 a

subSubSection.paragraph:
misidentification:
faldermanni eoa :
Bílý 1983 a
: 31
(not
Obenberger 1923 a
) (V. Kubáň, personal communication).
Host plant(s) within Iran .
(Adult!)
Anchusa officinalis
( Boraginaceae ) (Sakenin et al . 2008 ).

Distribution outside Iran .
None recorded.

Note. According to V. Kubáň (personal communication), part of specimens identified as
J. c. gotwendensis
(Loc. no. 308 ),
J. euphratica beludjistana
and
J. e. euphratica
(both from Loc. no. 304 ) in
Bily ( 1983 a)
actually belong to
J . consobrina consobrina
. The records for Kerman, Kermanshah, Sistan & Baluchestan, Tehran (
Borumand 2002
), and Khorasan (Sakenin et al . 2008 ) are most probably misidentifications with different subspecies of
J. euphratica
. Additionaly,
J . pietzehmanni
var. deserticoloides Théry 1926
(see below) is a junior synonym of
J. c. gotwendensis
. According to V. Kubáň,
J. c. consobrina
is a habitant of clay and stony soils on the hills while
J. c. gotwendensis
is associated with coastal sandy soils.

Théry 1925
), Iran (no locality cited) (
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006
;
Bellamy 2008 a
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution outside Iran .
None recorded.
Note. This species is known only from type locality (V. Kubáň, personal communication).

Reitter 1905
(see below); specimens indicated for Khuzestan (
Bílý 1983 a, Locs. no. 285 and 286
) actually originated from Lorestan.

Host plant(s) within Iran .
Pistacia
roots ( Anacardiaceae ) (
Farahbakhsh 1960
;
Adeli 1972
), (Adult!)
Pistacia
spp., bark (
Abai & Adeli 1984
), pistachio, tamarisk (
Tamarix
sp., Tamaricaceae ) (
Modarres Awal 1997
),
Tamarix
spp., sapwood (
Abai & Adeli 1984
),
Cerasus vulgaris
( Rosaceae ) (Sakenin et al . 2008 ).

Obenberger 1924 b
: 6

: 72

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note. Probably misidentification, this subspecies known only from Pakistan . According to V. Kubáň (personal communication), all records in
Bílý ( 1983 a)
refer to
J. e. scenica
Kerremans 1905
, record for Semnan (
Hadian et al . 2012
) and records for western, northern and central Iran most probably refer to
J. e. karelinii
Mannerheim 1837
.

subSubSection.paragraph:

Iran (no locality cited) (

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note. According to V. Kubáň (personal communication), the records for
J. euphratica beludjistana Obenberger 1924
from western, northern and central Iran most probably refer to this subspecies.

Note.
J. nusskina sensu
Bílý 1983 a
(not
Obenberger 1924 c
) (synonym of
euphratica beludjistana sensu
Bílý 1983 a
, not
Obenberger 1924 c
) corresponds to
J. euphratica scenica
(V. Kubáň, personal communcation). This subspecies is known only from Afghanistan and Pakistan .

subSubSection.paragraph:

from South-East Iran refer to this subspecies.

Note. According to V. Kubáň (personal communication), records for Bushehr and Kermanshah in
Radjabi ( 1974 )
and
Borumand ( 2002 )
are most probably misidentifications of
J. punctatocostata
Gory 1840
(Bushehr) and
J. laevicostata
Gory 1840
(Kermanshah).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

(subspecies of onopordi );
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006

.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution outside Iran .

misidentification:
aeneipes :
Radjabi & Gigli 2012
: 3
(V. Kubáň, personal communication).

Note. According to V. Kubáň (personal communication)
J. pietzehmanni
var. deserticoloides
is a junior synonym of
J. consobrina gotwendensis
. It is possible that all records of
J. pietzchmanni
from Iran refer to the latter (Bushehr, Khuzestan, Kuhgiloyeh & Boyerahmad, Isfahan) and
J. aeneipes
( Fars ).

synonym: beesoni
Obenberger 1934 e
: 186 ; Kubáň 2006 : 47 (synonym of
proxima
).

misidentification:
euphratica :
Radjabi & Gigli 2012
: 3
(V. Kubáň, personal communication).

Note. According to V. Kubáň (personal communication) most records for
J. iris
(except for loc. no. 8 ) in
Théry ( 1925 )
refer to
J. euphratica bushirensis Obenberger 1928
and
J. euphratica karelinii
Mannerheim 1837
; the records for Fars , "generally distributed except Caspian Sea area" in
Radjabi ( 1968 )
and
Modarres Awal ( 1997 )
, and Hormozgan, Ilam, Sistan & Baluchestan, Tehran in
Borumand ( 2002 )
are most probably misidentifications, this rare species occurs only in Western Iran .

Distribution outside Iran .
None recorded.

Note. According to V. Kubáň (personal communication)
J. p. punctatocostata
(Western Fars ) and
J. p. ramifera
("Persepolis") are known from Fars ; the record for East Azarbaijan in
Radjabi ( 1968 )
and
Modarres Awal ( 1997 )
refer to
J. laevicostata
Gory 1840
.

).

synonym: oberthuri

Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006

Holyński 2014
: 23 (subspecies of whitehilli Gray 1832 ).
synonym: seminata Abeille de Perrin 1904 : 211 .
synonym: amurensis Abeille de Perrin 1904 : 211 .

Host plant(s) within Iran .
Larvae attack roots Pistachio (
Pistacia
, Anacardiaceae ), lucerne (
Medicago
),
Alhagi
( Fabaceae ) (
Farahbakhsh 1960
;
Modarres Awal 1997
),
Pistacia
spp., bark (
Abai & Adeli 1984
),
Alhagi maurorum
( Fabaceae ) (Makhan et al . 2012 ).

Note. Specimens of
J. variolaris variolaris
from West Azarbaijan (Loc. no. 267 ) in
Bílý ( 1983 a)
belong to
J. faldermanni
(see above) (V. Kubáň, personal communication).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

Holyński 1984
: 524
(subspecies of
variolaris
);
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006
: 329
;
Bellamy 2008 a
: 83
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution within Iran .
Fars (
Holyński 1984
), Iran (no locality cited) (
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006
;
Bellamy 2008 a
: 83 ).

Distribution outside Iran .
None recorded.

Host plant(s) within Iran .
(Adult!) Milk vetch (
Astragalus
sp., Fabaceae ) (
Salavatian 1950
;
Modarres Awal 1997
).

Distribution outside Iran .
Afghanistan , Pakistan (
Kubáň & Volkovitsh 2006
;
Bellamy 2008 a
). Note. According to V. Kubáň (personal communication)
J. variolaris eoa
in
Bílý ( 1983 a, Loc. no. 308 )
actually belongs to
J. consobrina gotwendensis
. Occurrence of this subspecies in Iran needs confirmation.

undulata Heyden 1883 : 107

Distribution within Iran .

), Markazi, central provinces (
Abai & Adeli 1984
), northern provinces (

;
Modarres Awal 1997
), Iran (no locality cited) (

).
Distribution outside Iran .
Afghanistan , Turkmenistan , Uzbekistan (
Bellamy 2008 a
). Note. According to V. Kubáň (personal communication) all records for different subspecies of
J. variolaris
with the exception
J. v. brendelli Holyński
from Fars and
J. v. eoa Obenberger
from Sistan & Baluchestan refer to
J. v. variolaris
.
